image.altText: a woman and a man smiling to the camera with Adelaide Oval lit up in the background at night

props.synopsis: Luke Sweetman had so much of his life ahead of him when he was punched in a "horrific attack" outside a suburban Adelaide hotel last year. Now, his family has confronted his killer.

title.children: One-punch victim's family confront 'unhinged and volatile' killer

image.altText: A night scene of a tree branch fallen on the ground, with lights strung up behind

props.synopsis: Two people were injured — and one was taken to hospital — when a tree branch fell in Botanic Park during the WOMADelaide festival on Monday. Emergency services are urging people to take care near heat stressed trees after a hot summer.

title.children: Two injured in 'awful, tragic' tree branch fall during WOMADelaide

image.altText: A woman in a headscarf sitting under a tree.

props.synopsis: A newly-opened multi-million-dollar apartment complex in Adelaide's CBD will help women like Kiran escape from violent relationships.

title.children: Affordable apartments to help family violence survivors 'rebuild their lives'

image.altText: A large lightning bolt strikes Portland

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old woman was taken to Millicent hospital with non-life-threatening injuries during a severe thunderstorm, which also sparked close to 100 fires and left thousands without power.

title.children: Woman struck by lightning in SA's South East during severe thunderstorms

image.altText: A woman outstretched her hands while singing into a microphone stand. A stage light illuminates her from below.

props.synopsis: You might come to WOMADelaide for the headliners, but you'll leave with a new favourite band.

title.children: Forget your favourites — WOMADelaide's best moments come from new discoveries

image.altText: A large bin parked in a carpark outside a childcare facility

props.synopsis: A former employee of childcare provider Genius Education says the company owes staff thousands in unpaid superannuation and workers were not able to say a proper goodbye to the children they cared for.

title.children: Worker claims childcare company owes staff thousands of dollars in super

image.altText: A woman holding a nail gun on a construction site

props.synopsis: As Australia's construction industry continues to suffer from a worker shortage, some female tradies say more women want to take up the tools but are prevented by sexist attitudes on the job site.

title.children: Chippy loves her trade, but says sexist remarks are a barrier for women

image.altText: A cave diver wearing a yellow helmet, blue mask and black wetsuit squeezes between rocks.

props.synopsis: Curious divers on South Australia's Limestone Coast are hoping to one day be able to dive into one cave and come out another, after discovering an underground tunnel.

title.children: Cave divers' push to unexplored territory uncovers 100m tunnel

image.altText: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm stand on dry and cracked ground, in front of a small dam

props.synopsis: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm say they would be "in big trouble" if they were not able to pump water from a neighbour's dam. They are calling on the state government to provide more support for farmers enduring the current drought conditions.

title.children: SA farmers 'battling through some of the toughest times I can remember'

image.altText: A wind turbine, as seen from close proximity, towering above bushland where other turbines stand.

props.synopsis: Residents in the south-west Victorian town of Nelson say building the some of the biggest wind turbines in Australia will harm the look and environment of the picturesque area.

title.children: 270m-high wind turbine plan generates opposition in Victorian town

image.altText: A guard tower in a correctional centre behind razor wire.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for public assistance to help locate a 28-year-old man who escaped from Broken Hill Correctional Centre on Sunday.

title.children: Police hunt inmate who escaped outback correctional centre

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: SA's Public Service Association has called for urgent reform, claiming three prisoners have been violently assaulted by other inmates in the past week — with each incident resulting in hospitalisations.

title.children: Prisoner in hospital after third violent attack in week, SA union says

image.altText: Tom Campbell poses with a football at the MCG after signing with Melbourne

props.synopsis: They're the backbone of every sporting team, the bench players who spend months or even years waiting to get their moment in the spotlight.

title.children: Here's to bench warmers, the unsung heroes of sporting teams

image.altText: Five children sit on a fence with a sign that reads 'Devonborough Downs'., wear hats, sky with white clouds, brown earth.

props.synopsis: Families on remote outback stations say they've been left in the lurch after a student boarding house closed suddenly.

title.children: Outback parents scramble to find accommodation after hostel closure

image.altText: A mother plays with her kid, drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence and child protection workers could leave if South Australia pushes ahead with proposed guidelines for a national-first social worker registration scheme, advocates are warning.

title.children: Concerns 'children could die' under proposed details for social worker registration scheme

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage fatigues and balaklava stands on a raised platform armed with a an AK-47 gun.

props.synopsis: The ABC journeyed into Syria's coastal city of Tartous, where deadly clashes between militias loyal to the fallen regime of Bashar al-Assad and government forces have spiralled into some of the worst violence in the country in years.

title.children: A huge massacre allegedly happened in Syria. Here's what we know

image.altText: Man grimaces while looking at screen of data.

props.synopsis: Australia's share market has closed on a seven-month low and it now sits 8.4 per cent below the all-time high it reached in mid-February, as global investors consider the potential damage of US President Donald Trump's various trade wars.

title.children: ASX falls to seven-month closing low

image.altText: Donald Trump points at reporters through a doorway on Air Force One

props.synopsis: There is a real possibility the world's biggest economy is heading toward a recession and it is threatening to drag the world's biggest share market into a crash.

title.children: Is Trump's plan to 'make America great again' about to push it into recession?

image.altText: Penny Wong  on Terrorgram sanctions

props.synopsis: The foreign minister has responded after the Russian ambassador said there would be "grave consequences" for Australia if it joined a peacekeeping presence in Ukraine.

title.children: Australia 'won't be intimidated' by Russian warning on Ukraine, Wong says

image.altText: Mark Carney standing behind a podium delivering a speech in front of the Canadian flag

props.synopsis: Canada’s next prime minister steps into the role with no prior political experience but a distinguished career in global finance.

title.children: Mark Carney: Canada's answer to Trump's trade war

image.altText: a sign that reads closed until further notice stay safe hangs outside a shop in lismore as the town prepares for cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: In addition to the human cost, the financial cost of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred is rising across the economy.

title.children: The economic cost of ex-Cyclone Alfred could be $1 billion a day

image.altText: Donald Trump and Malcolm Turnbull shake hands.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull clashes with the ABC as he warns Australia cannot self-censor "for fear of offending the huge ego of Donald Trump", and suggests Anthony Albanese will not be to blame if his government fails to secure tariff exemptions.

title.children: In tetchy ABC interview, Turnbull says Australia cannot self-censor to please Trump

image.altText: An artists' impression of the war memorial showing a fighter jet in a large exhibition space.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: 'Disneyland of war': The war memorial's divisive transformation

image.altText: Drone image of Wharton Beach, where the shark attack took place.

props.synopsis: Authorities have not been able to recover the body of surfer Steven Jeffrey Payne after he was fatally attacked by a shark at Wharton Beach, near Esperance on Monday.

title.children: Melbourne surfer in fatal shark attack at WA beach identified

image.altText: Head and shoulder shot of Mike Nahan

props.synopsis: Former WA Liberal leader Mike Nahan blasts his colleagues for failing to provide a "coherent alternative" ahead of the party's latest election rout, saying upper house MPs did not do enough to engage with the community.

title.children: 'Didn't get off their bums': Liberal blame game begins after WA election

image.altText: A police car waits in the driveway of a suburban large property

props.synopsis: Police say organised crime groups are responsible for the explosives-laden caravan discovered in January at Dural in Sydney's north-west.

title.children: Dural caravan plot was 'fake terrorism', police say. Here's what we know

image.altText: A highschool kid punts an american football at sun set, wearing pads and a helmet

props.synopsis: The lead plaintiff in a US class action against Australian punters in American college football says he just wants a level playing field for high school students hoping to get a collegiate scholarship.

title.children: Anti-Australian punting class action plaintiff wants equity for US kids

image.altText: Flames and smoke rise after a cargo ship struck an oil tanker off the north-eastern coast of England.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 36 people were brought to shore after the incident off the north-eastern coast of England.

title.children: Tanker hired by US military ablaze off UK coast after strike by container ship

image.altText: Headshot of a young man in sunglasses and a pale blue hoodie against a cloudy blue sky

props.synopsis: A former Perth childcare worker who sexually assaulted a three-year-old girl in his care could be eligible for parole after seven and a half months in prison.

title.children: Perth childcare worker jailed for sexually assaulting three-year-old

image.altText: A woman makes moonshine in Bihar, India.

props.synopsis: A ban on alcohol created to protect women from domestic violence in India's Bihar has bred a criminal underworld.

title.children: A state with 130 million people banned booze. It unleashed chaos

image.altText: Lino Atem wears a basketball top and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Nine teenagers are among those arrested after 24-year-old Lino Atem was killed in what police allege was a "ferocious" and "targeted" ambush at a park in Melbourne's south-west.

title.children: Police arrest 13 people over stabbing death of Lino Atem

image.altText: Man with floodwaters up to his shins stands with dog in backyard

props.synopsis: Working out how to claim insurance is confusing at the best of times. Here's how to claim, and the steps to take to make the insurance process easier.

title.children: The evidence you need to make an insurance claim after flooding

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Suddenly, working from home is being debated in Canberra. But who benefits if it becomes an election issue?

title.children: The work from home debate is 'dangerous territory' for politicians

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer says he is heartbroken to reveal his brain cancer has returned after revolutionary treatment kept the aggressive tumour at bay for more than 18 months.

title.children: 'I'm not ready to die': Professor Richard Scolyer's heartbreaking prognosis

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy gestures as he talks to media

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with the Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah, as the Middle East nation tries to assert itself as a peace maker between Ukraine and Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy arrives in Saudi Arabia ahead of Ukraine peace talks
